TITLE: A New Area of A.I. Booms, Even Amid the Tech Gloom
SUMMARY: An investment frenzy over “generative artificial intelligence” has gripped Silicon Valley, as tools that generate text, images and sounds in response to short prompts seize the imagination.

TITLE: FTC Chair Lina Khan on the Problems with Noncompetes
SUMMARY: The chairwoman of the F.T.C. argues in favor of a proposal to eliminate noncompete clauses from employee contracts.

TITLE: After a Burst of New Businesses, a Cooling Economy Intrudes
SUMMARY: The pandemic has brought a boom in entrepreneurship, but higher interest rates, a chill in venture capital and fears of recession now pose obstacles.

TITLE: Entrepreneurs Flee China’s Heavy Hand: ‘You Don’t Have to Stay There’
SUMMARY: Weary of crackdowns and lockdowns, businesspeople are moving out of China and taking their wealth with them. Many have found a new home in Singapore.

TITLE: 6 Podcasts to Help Navigate Your Career Path
SUMMARY: Check out these shows whether you’re looking to start a business, pivot to a new industry or just better handle office politics.

TITLE: How Waze Changed the Way We Drive
SUMMARY: A new book by the company’s co-founder Uri Levine offers lessons on succeeding as an entrepreneur.

TITLE: Anthropic Said to Be Closing In on $300 Million in New A.I. Funding
SUMMARY: Anthropic specializes in generative artificial intelligence, a hot investment in Silicon Valley. The new funding could value the company at roughly $5 billion.

TITLE: ‘Recession Resilient’ Climate Start-Ups Shine in Tech Downturn
SUMMARY: Tech workers and investors are flocking to start-ups that aim to combat climate change.

TITLE: Why Grandma’s Nutrition Drink Is So Hard to Disrupt
SUMMARY: Upstarts have tried, and mostly failed, to compete with shakes like Ensure and Boost. They say the brands’ ties to health care providers make it tough.

TITLE: Selling Trump Isn’t What It Used to Be
SUMMARY: Donald Trump has reunited with a former business partner to sell online trading cards, hoping to recreate a once-profitable mix of hype and celebrity. Initial sales hint at how difficult that will be in 2023.

TITLE: Marianne Mantell, Who Helped Pave the Way for Audiobooks, Dies at 93
SUMMARY: In her early 20s she co-founded the groundbreaking spoken-word record label Caedmon, which had a hit with Dylan Thomas’s “A Child’s Christmas in Wales.”

TITLE: A Watch Dealing Mogul, at 19
SUMMARY: Linden Lazarus has spent most of his teen years selling timepieces. Now, he has employees to help out.

TITLE: Red McCombs, Car Salesman Turned Media Mogul, Dies at 95
SUMMARY: A Texas entrepreneur, he co-founded the media giant Clear Channel, owned pro sports teams and created more than 400 businesses in a variety of industries.

TITLE: Tech Leaders in Israel Wonder if It’s Time to Leave
SUMMARY: Ahead of a judicial overhaul that could transform the country and frighten away investors, the executives of Start-Up Nation are mulling an exodus.

TITLE: After Bank Debacle, Silicon Valley Reckons With Its Image
SUMMARY: Even as start-ups and investors began recovering their money from Silicon Valley Bank, the episode exposed the tech industry’s vulnerabilities.

TITLE: AI Funding Frenzy Escalates
SUMMARY: In just weeks, a gold rush into artificial intelligence start-ups has become a full-blown mania.

TITLE: Silicon Valley Bank’s Deep Ties to the Tech Industry
SUMMARY: More than many other banks, SVB catered to how risky tech start-ups and their backers do not adhere to normal business practices.

TITLE: Crypto Wants Its Shine Back
SUMMARY: After a miserable year, cryptocurrency companies are looking for ways to rebrand products that many consumers no longer trust.

TITLE: Lindsay Lohan and Jake Paul Among Crypto Endorsers Charged by SEC
SUMMARY: The agency charged Justin Sun with violations of securities law in a scheme involving the actress Lindsay Lohan and other celebrities.

TITLE: When Your Career, and Retirement, Are the Family’s Business
SUMMARY: Succession plans, or the lack thereof, can hinder the transition to a new generation — and affect how loved ones fund their later years.

TITLE: Gordon E. Moore, Intel Co-Founder Behind Moore’s Law, Dies at 94
SUMMARY: His prediction in the 1960s about rapid advances in computer chip technology charted a course for the age of high tech.

TITLE: Silicon Valley Bank’s Collapse Chills Start-Up Funding
SUMMARY: Two weeks after the bank failed, the fallout has hit the start-up market as investors pull back further and fear has risen.

TITLE: Turmoil at ‘Chief’ Raises the Question: Is Empowering Corporate Women Enough?
SUMMARY: Turmoil at Chief, a women’s networking organization, raises a long-simmering question: Is amassing power for corporate women a worthy goal in itself?

TITLE: Lesbian Bars in Los Angeles Change With the Times
SUMMARY: Two recent openings testify to the power, and joy, of queer spaces.

TITLE: How Small Businesses Can Find Safety Before the Next Bank Crisis
SUMMARY: Financial advisers recommend that business owners examine their accounts now to ensure they are protected in case of a future bank failure.

TITLE: How African Restaurant Baobab Fare Found Success in Detroit
SUMMARY: Hamissi Mamba, a refugee from Burundi, knew little of American culture when he arrived eight years ago and learned English watching the “Peppa Pig” cartoon. But he opened his dream restaurant, and the accolades have rolled in.

TITLE: On His Podcast ‘Wine and Hip Hop,’ Jermaine Stone Aims to Bridge Cultures
SUMMARY: As the wine industry flagged in its commitment to Black and brown communities, this consultant forged his own path.

TITLE: Olive Oil Feud: The Social Media Spat Between Graza and Brightland
SUMMARY: An entrepreneur said a rival olive oil start-up ripped off his big idea.

TITLE: For Founders of Small Businesses, the Personal Story Matters
SUMMARY: A business owner’s personal story can bolster trust in a brand, experts say. But what happens when they share hardships like homelessness, addiction or incarceration in company marketing?

TITLE: How These Budding Entrepreneurs Won $20,000 for Their Start-Ups
SUMMARY: A new competition encourages New Yorkers who live in public housing to pursue their own businesses.

TITLE: Elizabeth Holmes Opens Up About Her Theranos Trial and What Comes Next
SUMMARY: The black turtlenecks are gone. So is the voice. As the convicted Theranos founder awaits prison, she has adopted a new persona: devoted mother.

TITLE: Once an Evangelist for Airbnbs, She Now Crusades for Affordable Housing
SUMMARY: Precious Price ditched her profitable business  of renting home stays to tourists to combat the mounting housing crisis.

TITLE: Reid Hoffman Is Praising the Virtues of AI
SUMMARY: Few are as involved in so many different artificial intelligence efforts as Mr. Hoffman, a Silicon Valley investor who co-founded LinkedIn.
